lines.text: As far as I'm concerned, the law killed Buddy.

[after a pause]
Watcha gonna do about it, Hoppy?

[after another pause]
Whatta you think?
Ah, by crickety, I'm with yeh!
I ain't hankering to get you into trouble, Windy.
Awww, trouble don't mean nuthin' to me.

[smiling slightly]
All right, you figure it out while I get my riggin'.

[to Lucky after Hoppy has left]
Trouble? Why, I was hatched in trouble! Born on an open range in a howlin' blizzard! Cut my teeth on a gun barrel! Fed on cactus soup til I was six! Peh, he talks about herdin' me into trouble! Peh, heh, ha, huh!

[introducing Windy to Crowder as a piano player for the saloon]
Brought you a new professor - Windy Halliday, known far and wide as a cowboy troubador.

[to Windy]
This is Ace Crowder. He runs the place.
Hi.
Professor, ah?
[laughs derisively]
Looks more like something than crawled out of the bung hole of a beer keg!

[to Windy]
Can ye play the piana?
Shoo, heck, can I play the pi-an-ie? Why up in Deadwood City the cowboys used to call me the Padderhooski of the Weat!
[laughs]
Yeah! Around cowboys he's known as a musician, but around musicians he's known as a cowboy.
Number eight on the black.
That's me again.
Well, Bill, you must have been born with a silver horseshoe in your mouth!

[humorously]
Why, Annie, you ain't insinuatin' I got a big mouth, are you?

[flirtatiously]
Big or little, good-lookin', you got a nice mouth.
[he smiles]
Say, are you the big chief around here, or are you talkin' for somebody else?
I'm the big chief's right hand man.
Oh... right hand man, hunh? That's fine...

[he walks toward the door and turns]
You get this, Crowder - I don't do business with anybody's right hand man!
[he leaves and slams the door behind him]
[last lines]

[wistfully as Hoppy rides out of town]
Funny, all my life men like Cassidy been sayin' goodbye to me.
Where's Stoneham?
He went bye-bye on the choo-choo.
